title.narrative: Negotiation and Mediation as a Tool for Conflict Resolution

description.narrative: Clingendael offers tailored trainings in negotiation and mediation skills, both at the Clingendael Institute, on location and online. Clingendael training sessions help participants to develop a reliable set of negotiation or mediation skills.
Our trainings target: 1) negotiators representating groups in conflict, 2) mediators of peace initiatives, 3) mediation trainers, through or Trainings-of-Trainers (ToT).

To enhance the quality and competences of negotiators and mediators that are actively taking part in peace negotiation processes ? whether locally, regionally or internationally ? in order to support existing peace initiatives of NGOs and of international and regional organisations.

title.narrative: Annual Report 2019
Conflict negotiation training

description.narrative: Conflict actors, civil society representatives and other relevant persons are trained in conflict negotiation knowledge and skills, including on inclusivity and gender issues.

description.narrative: Mediators, civil society actors and other relevant persons are trained in mediation knowledge and skills, including on inclusivity and gender issues

title.narrative: Strengthened capacity of mediators

description.narrative: Strengthened capacity (knowledge, skills and confidence) of mediators to design and conduct mediation processes.

title.narrative: Confidence in ability to be part of a negotiation process

description.narrative: In 2017 and 2018 this was measured as the percentage of respondents who answered the question "How confident are you in your ability to be part of a negotiation process as a mediator (support)?" with 'confident' or 'very confident'; in 2019 this was measured as the percentage of participants who answered the statement "I feel confident being part of a negotiation process as a mediator (support)" with 'agree or 'strongly agree'

title.narrative: Confidence in ability to analyse negotiating parties

description.narrative: In 2017 and 2018 this was measured as the percentage of respondents who answered the question "Do you feel that you can distinguish clearly between needs, interests and positions of the negotiation parties?" with 'confident' or 'very confident'; in 2019 this was measured as the percentage of participants who answered the statement "I am able to analyse the negotiating parties, both before and during a negotiation" with 'agree or 'strongly agree'

title.narrative: Confidence in ability to guide negotiating parties

description.narrative: In 2017 and 2018 this was measured as the percentage of respondents who answered the question "How confident are you in your ability to guide parties to formulate/improve strategies for their negotiation?" with 'confident' or 'very confident'; in 2019 this was measured as the percentage of participants who answered the statement "I am able to guide parties to formulate/improve strategies for their negotiation" with 'agree or 'strongly agree'

title.narrative: Confidence in preparing (strategically) for a negotiation

description.narrative: In 2017 and 2018 this was measured as the percentage of respondents who answered the question "How confident are you in using the mediation and negotiation preparation tools?" with 'confident' or 'very confident'; in 2019 this was measured as the percentage of participants who answered the statement "I know how to prepare strategically for a mediation or negotiation process" with 'agree or 'strongly agree'

title.narrative: Confidence in ability to contribute to constructive atmosphere

description.narrative: In 2017 and 2018 this was measured as the percentage of respondents who answered the question "How confident are you in your ability to contribute to a constructive atmosphere in a mediation process?" with 'confident' or 'very confident'; in 2019 this was measured as the percentage of participants who answered the statement "I am able to contribute to a constructive atmosphere during a negotiation/mediation process" with 'agree or 'strongly agree'

title.narrative: Confidence in ability to support negotiatiors

description.narrative: In 2017 and 2018 this was measured as the percentage of respondents who answered the question "How confident are you in your ability to support negotiators as a mediator (support) during a peace process?" with 'confident' or 'very confident'; in 2019 this was measured as the percentage of participants who answered the statement I know how to support negotiators as a mediator (support) during a peace process" with 'agree or 'strongly agree'

title.narrative: Confidence in ability to recognize and respond to negotiation tactics

description.narrative: In 2017 and 2018 this was measured as the percentage of respondents who answered the question "How comfortable do you feel in recognizing negotiation tactics of the parties and responding to these? " with 'comfortable' or 'very comfortable'; in 2019 this was measured as the percentage of participants who answered the statement "I know how to respond to negotiation tactics used by the negotiating parties" with 'agree or 'strongly agree'

title.narrative: Confidence in ability to make negotiation process more inclusive

description.narrative: In 2017 and 2018 this was measured as the percentage of respondents who answered the question "How confident are you in your ability to make a mediation and/or negotiation process more relevant for women and/or minority groups?" with 'confident' or 'very confident'; in 2019 this was measured as the percentage of participants who answered the statement "I am able to make a negotiation process more relevant for women and/or minority groups" with 'agree or 'strongly agree'

title.narrative: Percentage of participants who demonstrate or indicate a greater understanding of negotiation processes

description.narrative: Measured as the percentage of participants who increase their score for knowledge-related questions in the pre- and post-course questionnaire

title.narrative: Increased ability to conduct effective conflict negotiations or mediation

description.narrative: Percentage of trainings in which the trainer observes that the trained group has increased their skills on this particular topic

title.narrative: Strengthened capacity of negotiators

description.narrative: Strengthened capacity (knowledge, skills and confidence) of negotiators to plan and conduct conflict negotiations.

title.narrative: Confidence in ability to recognize and respond to negotiation tactics

description.narrative: In 2017 and 2018 this was measured as the percentage of respondents who answered the question "How comfortable do you feel in recognizing negotiation tactics and responding to these?" with 'comfortable' or 'very comfortable'; in 2019 this was measured as the percentage of participants who answered the statement "I know how to respond to negotiation tactics" with 'agree or 'strongly agree'

title.narrative: Confidence in ability to make negotiation process more inclusive

description.narrative: In 2017 and 2018 this was measured as the percentage of respondents who answered the question "I feel I am able to make the negotiation process more relevant for women and/or minority groups " with 'confident' or 'very confident'; in 2019 this was measured as the percentage of participants who answered the statement "I am able to make a negotiation process more relevant for women and/or minority groups" with 'agree or 'strongly agree'

title.narrative: Confidence in ability to analyse counterparts

description.narrative: In 2017 and 2018 this was measured as the percentage of respondents who answered the question "Do you feel that you can make clear distinctions between needs, interests and positions of the negotiation parties? " with 'confident' or 'very confident'; in 2019 this was measured as the percentage of participants who answered the statement "I am able to analyse my counterpart, both before and during a negotiation process" with 'agree or 'strongly agree'

title.narrative: Confidence in ability to participate in a negotiation process

description.narrative: In 2017 and 2018 this was measured as the percentage of respondents who answered the question "How confident are you in your ability to participate effectively in a negotiation process?" with 'confident' or 'very confident'; in 2019 this was measured as the percentage of participants who answered the statement "I am able to effectively participate in a negotiation process" with 'agree or 'strongly agree'

title.narrative: Confidence in preparing (strategically) for a negotiation

description.narrative: In 2017 and 2018 this was measured as the percentage of respondents who answered the question "How confident are you in using negotiation preparation tools?" with 'confident' or 'very confident'; in 2019 this was measured as the percentage of participants who answered the statement "I know how to prepare strategically for a negotiation process" with 'agree or 'strongly agree'

title.narrative: Confidence in ability to support negotiatiors

description.narrative: In 2017 and 2018 this was measured as the percentage of respondents who answered the question "How confident are you in your ability to support negotiators during a peace process?" with 'confident' or 'very confident'; in 2019 this was measured as the percentage of participants who answered the statement "I am able to support my colleagues during a negotiation process" with 'agree or 'strongly agree'

title.narrative: Confidence in ability as negotiator

description.narrative: In 2017 and 2018 this was measured as the percentage of respondents who answered the question "I feel I am able to formulate/improve strategies as a negotiator " with 'confident' or 'very confident'; in 2019 this was measured as the percentage of participants who answered the statement "I feel confident when I negotiate" with 'agree or 'strongly agree'

title.narrative: Confidence in ability to contribute to constructive atmosphere

description.narrative: In 2017 and 2018 this was measured as the percentage of respondents who answered the question "I feel I am able to contribute to a constructive atmosphere in the negotiation process" with 'confident' or 'very confident'; in 2019 this was measured as the percentage of participants who answered the statement "I am able to contribute to a constructive atmosphere during a negotiation process" with 'agree or 'strongly agree'

description.narrative: Measured as the percentage of participants who increase their score for knowledge-related questions in the pre- and post-course questionnaire
